Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Histone H2A (antimicrobial protein; natural AMPs; Histone-derived; fish, animals)

Literature.Author: Fernandes JMO., Kemp GD., Molle MG., Smith VJ.2002
Literature.Title: Anti-microbial properties of histone H2A from skin secretions of rainbow trout, Oncorhynchus mykiss.

Sequence Information.Comments: Discovery: isolated chromatographically.Activity:  active against Gram+ A. viridans (MIC 0.08-0.15 uM), B. subtilis (MIC 0.6-1.2 uM), M. luteus (MIC 0.6-1.2 uM), P. citreus (MIC 0.08-0.15 uM), R. salmoninarum (MIC 0.15-0.3 uM), S-aureus (MIC >1.2 uM), A-hydrophila (MIC >1.2 uM), A-salmonicida 004 (MIC >1.2 uM), E-coli (MIC >1.2 uM), L-anguillarum (MIC >1.2 uM), Y-ruckeri (MIC >1.2 uM), and S. cerevisiae (MIC 0.3-0.6 uM).Entry history: Oringally only the partial sequence AERVGAGAPVYL from Edman degradation was entered. The sequence has been updated based on MS data in the paper.  Updated 7/2021; 11/2023
